rows.THREE-LEVEL ARCHITECTURE: Studio Level · Business Level · Funnel Level. Equal sophistication. Equal depth.

rows.col_2: How the system itself works. Production, labor, infrastructure, governance, AI, fundraising. The operating system of the venture studio.
rows.col_3:
~40 models (S0-S40)
Same depth as business level
rows.col_4: The coordination hedgefund thesis. The Trade system. The methodology.
rows.col_6: Nilo + Series Producer + Studio PM co-founders

rows.col_2: IonWave specifically. Product, marketing, operations, growth. Everything to launch and run the D2C brand.
The meta layer. Content, recruiting, selling the model itself. Nilo as Dan Crowley — making content that recruits AND sells the infrastructure.
rows.col_3:
~20 models (F0-F20)
Nilo's personal funnel + recruiting + content
rows.col_4: Lead magnets, courses, done-for-you Trades, the recruiting pipeline itself.
rows.col_5: Course/info ($500-2K). DFY ($25-100K). Recruiting (the people ARE the revenue — they build the businesses).
rows.col_6: Nilo directly. This is the Dan Crowley play.

rows.THREE-LEVEL ARCHITECTURE: FUNNEL LEVEL feeds STUDIO LEVEL feeds BUSINESS LEVEL
→ Content recruits PM co-founders, experts, investors (Funnel → Studio)
→ PM co-founders produce and verify models (Studio Level)
→ Verified models become the operating system for IonWave (Studio → Business)
→ IonWave launches and generates revenue (Business Level)
→ IonWave success becomes content for more recruiting (Business → Funnel)
The flywheel: Content → People → Models → Businesses → Proof → More Content
Nilo is Dan Crowley in two ways:
1. He runs the funnel that recruits (Dan Crowley the recruiter)
2. He IS the content that makes the funnel work (Dan Crowley the creator)
